verses.kjv: Paul, an apostle, (not of men, neither by man, but by Jesus Christ, and God the Father, who raised him from the dead;)
verses.ct: Paul, an apostle — not appointed by any human authority or through any person, but through Jesus Christ and God the Father, who raised him from the dead —

verses.kjv: And all the brethren which are with me, unto the churches of Galatia:
verses.ct: along with all the brothers and sisters here with me, to the churches of Galatia:

verses.kjv: Grace be to you and peace from God the Father, and from our Lord Jesus Christ,
verses.ct: May grace and peace be yours from God the Father and our Lord Jesus Christ,

verses.kjv: Who gave himself for our sins, that he might deliver us from this present evil world, according to the will of God and our Father:
verses.ct: who offered himself for our sins to rescue us from this current evil age, according to the will of our God and Father —

verses.kjv: To whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen.
verses.ct: to whom be glory forever and ever. Amen.

verses.kjv: I marvel that ye are so soon removed from him that called you into the grace of Christ unto another gospel:
verses.ct: I'm shocked that you are so quickly abandoning the one who called you by the grace of Christ and turning to a different gospel.

verses.kjv: Which is not another; but there be some that trouble you, and would pervert the gospel of Christ.
verses.ct: Not that there actually is another gospel — but certain people are disturbing you and trying to distort the gospel of Christ.

verses.kjv: But though we, or an angel from heaven, preach any other gospel unto you than that which we have preached unto you, let him be accursed.
verses.ct: Even if we ourselves, or an angel from heaven, should announce to you a gospel different from what we originally announced to you, let that person be cursed.

verses.kjv: As we said before, so say I now again, If any man preach any other gospel unto you than that ye have received, let him be accursed.
verses.ct: As we've already said, I'm saying it once more: if anyone announces to you a gospel different from what you already accepted, let that person be cursed.

verses.kjv: For do I now persuade men, or God? or do I seek to please men? for if I yet pleased men, I should not be the servant of Christ.
verses.ct: Am I trying to win the approval of people, or of God? Am I trying to make people happy? If I were still trying to please people, I would not be a servant of Christ.

verses.kjv: But I certify you, brethren, that the gospel which was preached of me is not after man.
verses.ct: I want you to know, brothers and sisters, that the gospel I announced to you did not originate from any human source.

verses.kjv: For I neither received it of man, neither was I taught it, but by the revelation of Jesus Christ.
verses.ct: I didn't receive it from any person, and no one taught it to me. Instead, it came through a revelation from Jesus Christ.

verses.kjv: For ye have heard of my conversation in time past in the Jews’ religion, how that beyond measure I persecuted the church of God, and wasted it:
verses.ct: You've certainly heard about my former way of life in Judaism — how I relentlessly persecuted God's church and tried to destroy it.

verses.kjv: And profited in the Jews’ religion above many my equals in mine own nation, being more exceedingly zealous of the traditions of my fathers.
verses.ct: I was advancing in Judaism beyond many of my peers in my own nation, being far more passionate about the traditions handed down from my ancestors.

verses.kjv: But when it pleased God, who separated me from my mother’s womb, and called me by his grace,
verses.ct: But God, who set me apart even before I was born and called me through his grace, was pleased

verses.kjv: To reveal his Son in me, that I might preach him among the heathen; immediately I conferred not with flesh and blood:
verses.ct: to reveal his Son to me so that I could proclaim him among the non-Jewish nations. When that happened, I didn't immediately consult with any human being.

verses.kjv: Neither went I up to Jerusalem to them which were apostles before me; but I went into Arabia, and returned again unto Damascus.
verses.ct: I also didn't go up to Jerusalem to meet with those who were apostles before me. Instead, I went away to Arabia and later returned to Damascus.

verses.kjv: Then after three years I went up to Jerusalem to see Peter, and abode with him fifteen days.
verses.ct: Then, 3 years later, I went up to Jerusalem to get to know Peter, and I stayed with him for 15 days.

verses.kjv: But other of the apostles saw I none, save James the Lord’s brother.
verses.ct: I didn't see any of the other apostles — only James, the Lord's brother.

verses.kjv: Now the things which I write unto you, behold, before God, I lie not.
verses.ct: I assure you in God's presence that what I'm writing to you is not a lie.

verses.kjv: Afterwards I came into the regions of Syria and Cilicia;
verses.ct: After that, I traveled to the regions of Syria and Cilicia.

verses.kjv: And was unknown by face unto the churches of Judaea which were in Christ:
verses.ct: The churches in Judea that are in Christ had never met me in person.

verses.kjv: But they had heard only, That he which persecuted us in times past now preacheth the faith which once he destroyed.
verses.ct: They had only heard others say, 'The man who used to persecute us is now proclaiming the very faith he once tried to destroy.'

verses.kjv: And they glorified God in me.
verses.ct: And they praised God because of me.
